text: hello this is chef john from food wishes
comm with pumpkin flan of course this is
awesome
any time of the year but imagine this
during the holidays so perfect and not
only are we making pumpkin flan we're
actually going to make a light pumpkin
flan using only low-fat milk is it going
to be as good as the one with heavy
cream no but it's going to be really
good anyway so our first step here we're
going to make our caramel sauce which is
just a cup of sugar with a couple
tablespoons of water
alright stir that together that just
gives it sort of a head start you can do
it with just sugar if you want put it on
medium heat and basically we're going to
cook it to like kind of a dark amber I'm
not good with color descriptions so you
should probably just look to see how I
did it see that it's a little light and
again I'm on like medium heat here maybe
just a hair under medium let me go to
the super-slow-mo
and that's just about what you're
looking for we don't want to go too dark
this shouldn't have a burnt taste like a
creme brulee alright so we're going to
take that off the heat and we are going
to divide it among our ramekins that
have been sprayed lightly with nonstick
vegetable spray just pour it right in
the bottom all right it'll spread out if
you want to tilt it around make sure the
bottom is covered go ahead but it'll be
fine just pouring it in now you're going
to have to read the post as far as all
the amounts this recipe will actually
make eight but I only prep six here for
the video and you want to make sure you
pour it in there kind of quick because
as you can hear that stuff turns really
hard when it cools alright so those are
filled with sugar just set those aside
for the custard we have five whole eggs
lots of cinnamon some pumpkin pie spice
some allspice some mace some salt make
sure you check food wishes for all the
exact amounts some sugar and we're going
to mix that up by the way one tip pop
your egg yolks and it will mix easier
all right so that's together I'm also
going to add one can of pure pumpkin
puree now god bless you if you're going
to buy one of those little sugar
pumpkins and roast it or cook it and
make your own puree you are better than
me alright so if you do do that great if
you don't no problem it's perfect with
canned pumpkin but use some nice organic
brand alright so once my pumpkin egg
mixture is smooth and together I'm going
to heat some low-fat milk on medium-low
heat
I don't want it to boil it I want it to
simmer
I want it to almost simmer so when you
see little bubbles on the edge all right
and you see steam and you see the
faintest bit of a film on top turn it
off now I like a little vanilla in here
and you can certainly use extract but I
had a vanilla bean a Tahitian vanilla
bean
so I scraped out the seeds and threw the
pod and the seeds in there into that hot
milk and just let it sit there for about
ten minutes all right and then what I'm
going to do is strain the hot milk
vanilla mixture into my bowl of pumpkin
egg and don't worry about it's crammed
on the eggs it's not that hot and as
soon as you pour it in there as soon as
you strain it in you're going to whisk
it so no danger once that's mixed you
are ready to fill your ramekins but not
all the way you know that but a half
inch from the top is perfect and again
this is enough for eight but I'm only
going to make six here for the demo so
all that info will be on the site I'm
going to fill them halfway up with very
hot water I just put a tea kettle on
doesn't have to be quite boiling but it
should be hot steaming water I'm going
to cover it with heavy duty foil come on
do yourself a favor and get some
heavy-duty foil while you try to piece
together that little thin stuff come on
we're going to wrap that up we're going
to put it in a preheated 300 degree oven
for 45 to 50 minutes or until just set
okay and what does that mean this is
what it means if I shake it with my
tongs
it'll wiggle it'll jiggle but the middle
won't look liquidy okay that's pretty
damn sexy - and another less provocative
method for telling if it's set if you
stick in a thin knife it will come out
perfectly clean so the tip of a paring
knife see that that's done I'm going to
carefully remove them from the water let
them sit till the room temperature wrap
refrigerate for at least four hours then
you can do this run a knife around the
edge to make sure it's loose flip it
over on a plate or bowl take the ramekin
off and check that out unbelievable that
beautiful caramel bottom is now a
beautiful shiny caramel top the sugar
basically is melted from the moisture of
the flan and made like a thin sauce and
of course because it's pumpkin we're
going to garnish with pumpkin seeds
which are quite gorgeous if you ask me
and then let me try this for low-fat
milk this is
surprisingly rich if you don't want a
light version use cream or part cream
part half and a half up to you alright
so this is the low fat milk version
certainly not going to be as rich and
decadent but still very very nice like I
said would be spectacular for any any
holiday entertaining I really hope you
give this a try go to the site all the
ingredients are there and as always
enjoy
